etymology.description: phonetic: 厂(厂) (hǎn) + semantic: 彣(彣) (wén, "variegated; literary talent") = represents someone with literary or scholarly talent -> talented
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the phonetic element 厂(厂) (hǎn) with the semantic 彣(彣) (wén, "literary talent"), highlighting the esteemed nature of the talent indicated. It suggests a person skilled or knowledgeable in literature.

examples.chinese: 他是一位才華橫溢的彥(他是一位才華橫溢的彥)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yī wèi cái huá héng yì de yàn.
examples.english: He is a person of exceptional talent.

examples.chinese: 在科技界中有一位彥展露非凡天賦(在科技界中有一位彥展露非凡天賦)，他的創新理念令人耳目一新(他的創新理念令人耳目一新)。
examples.pinyin: Zài kē jì jiè zhōng yǒu yī wèi yàn zhǎn lù fēi fán tiān fù, tā de chuàng xīn lǐ niàn lìng rén ěr mù yī xīn.
examples.english: In the world of technology, there is a talented individual demonstrating extraordinary abilities, and his innovative ideas are truly refreshing.
